title: The cost price of 40 articles is the same as the selling price of 25 articles. What is the gain percent? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends….! Let cost price of one article be ₹x Thus cost price of 40 articles will be 40x Selling price of 25 articles will be 40x Selling price of one article is 40x/25 = 1.60x We know Gain/Profit % = (selling price - cost price)/cost price ×100 Gain/Profit % = (1.60x - x)/x × 100 = 0.60x/x × 100 = 0.60 × 100 = 60% There was 60% gain/ profit on sale of articles Answer: There was 60% gain/ profit on sale of articles.

Answer is 60%. Let C & S respectively denote cost-price & sell-price of one article. According to given data we have, 40 * C = 25 * S or S/C = 40/25 Hence gain (profit) percentage = (S/C - 1) * 100 = (40/25 - 1)*100 = 60%
